Krayt Slayer Questrule changes have been made, Sidrona has them in the convo.A rule that seems to go unnoticed, do not target the crafting station until you should.Failure to follow Sidrona’s rules will cause you to be banned from all his content. There are no exceptions, no reversals, no sympathy.To be absolutely clear:1- when you enter this cave, do not target anything other than Sidrona or you will be sad.2- when you enter this cave, do not ever target a krayt unless directed by Sidrona to do so or you will be sad.3- read what Sidrona says carefully or you will be sad.4- failure to adhere to his rules will be bad for you and make you sad.Main Caveupon entering the main Sidrona cave, you are put on a 5 hour cooldown. This means you can spend up to 2 hours inside but on exit will have to wait 3 hours to go back inside. If you step inside and then back out, you cannot reenter for 5 hours. We highly recommend waiting a second or two before you enter to make sure you do not rubber band back out.Second Cavethis is the cave with the bosses Sidrona tells you to go to after you are done crafting components– This cave has a 6 hour cooldown that begins when you enter. So if you spend 3 hours of a buff session inside and leave, you cannot go back inside for 3 hours.– Just like above, if you enter and rubber band back out, you cannot enter for 6 hours so give yourself a few seconds before rushing inside.These timers cannot be reset by admins if you rubber band.

This has been completely revampedThe first check is to see if the highest damage attacker was a player or petIf not, you receive no XP. This is so players can’t use turrets or NPCs to help them kill the target.The second check is a loot rights check, where loot rights are assigned to the highest damage group (“group” can be a solo player)If not, you receive no XPOnce you pass the group loot rights check, then it checks to see if you (plus your pet) were the highest damage attackerIf you were the highest damage attacker, you will receive full XPIf another nearby player was the high damage attacker, your XP will be reduced by a divisorThis divisor is the number of players in range plus the number of pets in range where the owner is NOT in rangeExample: If a target is worth 1000 XP, and there is one player nearby and one pet nearby with the owner out of range, then the XP awarded would be 1000/(2+1) = 333 XP

KashyyykKashyyyk Hunting TrophiesHunting trophies can be looted from several of the rarest creatures on Kashyyyk.These trophies can be turned in to the Trandoshan Emissary of the Hunt, who will award you points for each one you turn in.The points can be spent on new decorative rewards.Populated a previously-empty cave on Kashyyyk.Originally used as a staging ground for the Warstalker Trandoshan clan, their tamed creatures seem to have gotten loose.Etyyy WeaponsAdded the missing certifications for the Xris Acid Sword and Etyyy Striker Pistol.Ambient sounds on Kashyyk will no longer sound like it’s raining over corrugated metal on sunny days. Instead it will now have a more ominous ambient sound to it with winds and rolling thunder.

Modifications to painting targetsNew skill tape(maybe plural), good luckSiege StrikeNew lootable items can be used by master demo experts to initiate a siege strikeThis is Player Versus Decoration, there are no PvP aspects to these.There is no need to fight the army that spawns, it’s just theatrics.When you drop a siege you will get a marker on that spot and a ring of markers will form around the area of the siegeThe ring goes away after 15 seconds but the one where you dropped the beacon will stay until the siege is overIf you try to launch another siege while this marker is there, it will not work, this is how the cooldown can be visually seen.Cooldown is 2.25 hours so that all the destroyed decorations can return to the original position before the next siegeThe radius of the siege is calculated from the damage range of the item.These can be sliced.There’s also a skill tape floating around that can help increase the range.All decoration rules applyIf you use a siege in a city with bases, you will perma destroy the decorations in the siege area.Non-PVP cities will get their stuff back as usual.Sieges use the exact same methods as regular bombs.
Modifications to painting targetsNew skill tape(maybe plural), good luck
New skill tape(maybe plural), good luck

Tantel Armor

Tantel armor was modified to provide a high stun resist option for players in PVE and PVP while still having a resist vulnerability to acid.This acid vulnerability is easily filled with a Krayt dragon scale which can result in armor that is 80%+ to everything except lightsaberThe intention was never to make armor that makes a player virtually unkillable by normal damage types, so we will be hardcapping the acid resist of Tantel armor at 45%This change applies to all current and future Tantel armor

Jail/Prison

A new player reform facility has been created in a secret locationThis will assist in making punishment simpleThere are two forms of punishment, time in prison and jail that you pay a fine to exit.There will be automated punishments in places where players can be detected breaking rules by using wall hacks and other exploits.Essentially Wicked built a jail for players that abuse his content and try and cheat. You WILL regret doing that.The CSR team will also be using this as a tool for violations not automatically detected in other areas.From Wicked’s reference above about Elysium, he will include in patch notes where possible, what is being tracked. He will be be as transparent as possible about what is cheating.Anyone that is attacking the creatures inside Elysium from outside or breaking through the wall, you WILL be sent to jail. There is no appeal process for this. You get one warning and one warning only. Do Not Mess With Wicked’s ContentPrisonPlayers that are sent to prison are put on a timer ranging from 30 mintues to two days.Once you have served your time, Warden Norton will let you out.You must talk to him, release from prison is not automatic.He will tell you how long your sentence is and how long you have left. If your time is up, he will set you free, if you ask politely.JailPlayers sent to jail are in for a rude awakening.  There are 7 levels of punishment, these may change over time but there will not be patch notes for any future change.1- player must pay a fine of 5 million credits.2- player must pay a fine of 10 million credits and the Punisher will revoke 3 skill boxes of his choosing.3- player must pay a fine of 20 million credits and the Punisher will revoke 9 skill boxes of his choosing.4- player must pay a fine of 30 million credits and the Punisher will revoke 18 skill boxes of his choosing. He will also fully remove you from the FRS if you are in it. If you are Mandalorian at any level you will be fully reset. If you have taken part in the Varactyl quest, you will be removed and all varactyls will be deleted from your datapad.5- player must pay a fine of 50 million credits and the Punisher will revoke 36 skill boxes of his choosing. He will also fully remove you from the FRS if you are in it. If you are Mandalorian at any level you will be fully reset. If you have taken part in the Varactyl quest, you will be removed and all varactyls will be deleted from your datapad.6- Player must pay 100 million credits, ALL skills will be removed except for force sensitive skills (because it gets buggy)7- Player has all inventory deleted, all credits removed. Player must file a ticket in Discord to discuss next step.To be clear, the first time you go to jail, you are at level 1. Next time, you advance to level 2 and so on until you reach level 7 where you are stuck there until you talk with the CSR team. There are no resets.One last note on the jail. There are not any secret loot items that you get if you go to jail. It is punishment only, there are no hidden rewards, prizes, paintings or anything. It all sucks to be there.

Only the player that kills Krayt dragons, Etyyy content and general world content will gain big game hunter experience.There was a misunderstanding with some code used to detect who killed a creature and when the code would fire.There are several places where this has been fixed but highly unlikely anyone had ever realized it due to the solo nature of those locations.Normally Wicked would cancel out the xp gained from this bug.  He is choosing not to do this but it should be noted that obtaining big game hunter xp on all lines except for world boss is a solo endeavor.  The quest is “Big Game Hunter” as in a solo hunter, it is not “Big Game Hunting Group Festivus”

Big Game HunterThe requirements to start were relaxed a while back allowing players to summon a king and kill it with a group. This has been reverted back to the original, you must solo kill a summoned krayt king to get the novice box.The alternatives remain the same, complete the Varactyl Quest or rack up 100,000 Jaggannath points.This balances entry to Big Game Hunter from fastest/toughest to slowest/easiest.

The requirements to start were relaxed a while back allowing players to summon a king and kill it with a group. This has been reverted back to the original, you must solo kill a summoned krayt king to get the novice box.
The alternatives remain the same, complete the Varactyl Quest or rack up 100,000 Jaggannath points.
This balances entry to Big Game Hunter from fastest/toughest to slowest/easiest.

Unstick commandThe /unstick command has been implemented! For those who don’t know, it previously did absolutely nothing.It has a 15 minute cooldownIt will randomly move you up to +/- 5 meters from your X,Y coordinatesIf outsideIt will not move you up more than 3 meters on the Z axisIt will attempt to avoid collisions with objectsIt will move you and your vehicle or mountIf insideThe command will not work inside structures due to desync issues

Commando Flamethrower SpecialsFlamethrower attacks have a 25% reduction in damage in PVP versus players and pets, but are supposed to have a +1 armor piercing value versus players to balance out damage to Jedi/normiesThis calculation was applying an extra +2 armor piercing versus all targets, and that has been changed to +1 in PVP versus players and pets onlyThe net result is that direct flamethrower attacks against armored targets in PVE and PVP is going to be reduced and the DOTs will do the heavy lifting as expected
Flamethrower attacks have a 25% reduction in damage in PVP versus players and pets, but are supposed to have a +1 armor piercing value versus players to balance out damage to Jedi/normies
This calculation was applying an extra +2 armor piercing versus all targets, and that has been changed to +1 in PVP versus players and pets only
The net result is that direct flamethrower attacks against armored targets in PVE and PVP is going to be reduced and the DOTs will do the heavy lifting as expected

Resist decay is now based on the mob’s percentage of total HAM (Health + Action + Mind)
This has been completely revamped from the Emu code which uses percentage of unmitigated damage

Resists will start dropping when the mob’s total HAM percentage goes below 75%Total Current HAM / Total HAMStarts at the 75% mark and continues to 25%, with resists dropping by 1% for every 1% reduction it total HAMWhen the percentage hits 25%, the resists will be reduced by half, which is the maximum amount
Total Current HAM / Total HAM
Starts at the 75% mark and continues to 25%, with resists dropping by 1% for every 1% reduction it total HAM
When the percentage hits 25%, the resists will be reduced by half, which is the maximum amount
Damage that reduces HAM will count toward the resist decay calculation including DOTs,  lightsaber damage, etc (currently wounds do not count this will be patched at a later date)
A similar calculation has been implemented for turrets using condition instead of HAM
Total Current HAM / Total HAM
Starts at the 75% mark and continues to 25%, with resists dropping by 1% for every 1% reduction it total HAM
When the percentage hits 25%, the resists will be reduced by half, which is the maximum amount
